definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

sentences.english: He stood like a swordsman in a ballet.
sentences.chinese: 他站着的姿勢活象一位芭蕾舞中的劍客。
她是那個時代最優秀的劍客。

sentences.english: The great swordsman people say was ever written?
sentences.chinese: 人們說這是至今最偉大的劍客？

sentences.english: "She was a swordsman, " he said finally.
sentences.chinese: “她是一名武士，一名劍客，”他終於開口了。

sentences.english: The greatest swordsman had missed his target completely, yet he continued to smile.
sentences.chinese: 最偉大的劍客失了準頭，而他仍在笑。

sentences.english: With the sword of Kuina’s, Zolo embarked on the road to becom the No.1 swordman in the world.
sentences.chinese: 帶着古伊娜的劍，卓洛踏上了成爲天下第一劍客之路。

sentences.english: At last, there were the best thirty swordsmen attended the final match.
sentences.chinese: 最後選出最精銳的劍客三十位進行決賽。

sentences.english: Matajuro became the greatest swordsman in the land.
As you know, I favor swordsman.
Bring champagne and a Three Musketeers bar"?"
sentences.chinese: 帶香檳和三劍客糖果棒？

sentences.english: He was the best wizard and she was the best swordsman.
From that day on, the three of them aspire to be musketeers.
sentences.chinese: 從那天起，他們三個立志成爲三劍客。

definition: venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
to be reluctant to give up a post
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
